instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PM_DSW_PWRGD: What is PM_DSW_PWRGD? The "PM_DSW_PWRGD" signal in a MacBook stands for "Deep Sleep Well Power Good” and is required for the machine to power on & post..
definitions.PM_RSMRST_L: What is PM_RSMRST_L? The "PM_RSMRST_L" signal, also known as "Resume Reset," is an active-low signal that is part of the power management system in MacBooks. It asserts a reset signal when it is low voltage which is what the _L is for. Is the machine is in a reset stage it will not properly power on..
definitions.RTC_RESET_L: What is RTC_RESET_L? RTC_RESET_L is a reset signal that is present when the signal is low, the _L means it is asserted when the voltage is low. The RESET signal will keep the PCH from turning on or booting up the machine. .
definitions.PCH_SRTCRST_L: What is PCH_SRTCRST_L? PCH_SRTCRST_L is a reset signal present for the RTC circuit that asserts when it is low in voltage, that is what _L means..
definitions.PCH_INTVRMEN_L: What is PCH_INTVRMEN_L? PCH_INTVRMEN_L is a signal that stands for Internal Voltage Regulator Enable. When pulled high, this signal enables the internal 1.05 V regulators for the Suspend well in the PCH. This signal must be pulled-up to PPVRTC_G3H..
definitions.PCH_INTRUDER_L: What is PCH_INTRUDER_L? PCH_INTRUDER_L is a signal that tells the machine the case has been opened by an intruder when it is low, the _L means it is present when it is low. This signal should always be high in a Macbook since it doesn’t use intrusion detection. .
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S3_L: What is PM_SLP_S3_L? PM_SLP_S3_L puts the machine to sleep in an S3 state when it is asserted, the _L means it is asserted when it is low voltage. When this signal is 3.3v the machine will be asked to turn on S0 power rails and begin the bootup process.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF: What is SMC_ONOFF? SMC_ONOFF is a signal that tells the machine that the power button has been pressed so it knows to turn on, or turn off. .

threads.title: 00138 won't turn back on after initial boot
threads.message:
This board will usually boot fine the first time but will often not turn back on with or without battery plugged in. On bench nothing plugged in if I shutoff by grounding <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> it wont restart. IN this state, I get 3.4V at <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> with and without keyboard plugged in. When triggering on/off I get voltage drop at <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL>. When it won't restart I tested voltages at <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> and everything looks good there.  Board always starts when I unplug and replug charger back in. Somerhing appears ro not be resetting when board stays connected to power but shut down manually or via OS. Only if removing all power.

<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> is not present. From what I can tell the below are all present:

<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>RTC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PCH_SRTCRST_L</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PCH_INTVRMEN_L</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PCH_DSWVRMEN_L</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PM_DSW_PWRGD</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PM_RSMRST_L</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL>

threads.title: 00138 won't turn back on after initial boot
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> reacts even when doesn't want to turn on?
Any pulse at <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> then (at same time)?

You've forgot to check <SIGNAL>PCH_INTRUDER_L</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: 00138 won't turn back on after initial boot
threads.message: I did forget to add to list: yes <SIGNAL>PCH_INTRUDER_L</SIGNAL> is good also. <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> does go to 3.3V  momentarily when toggling on/off while board is in state of being unable to start after shutdown.

threads.title: 00138 won't turn back on after initial boot
threads.message:
Then check for pulse at S3 voltages.
Do the same with <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL> abd S0 voltages.
Check if <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> pulses too.

Inspect <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> for corrosion.
Remove <TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR> and test again.

threads.title: 00138 won't turn back on after initial boot
threads.message:
Well you helped me discover some things I realized the board is cycling the rails even without triggering <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>.

<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is jumping to 3.3V every couple of seconds also. So if I shut the board off it seems to go to normal s5 state (rails are not pulsing), but once I trigger the board to start again, the board is continously trying to restart and I get pulse at <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>.

I couldn't get the board to PRAM reset when it was in the Mac so I PRAM reset via Medusa and also did cleanME. The board still won't start again without disconnecting power.

threads.title: 00138 won't turn back on after initial boot
threads.message:
Did all mentioned tests?

Just in case, test starting in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: 00138 won't turn back on after initial boot
threads.message:
Yes <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> good, Tried without <TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR>. 

If I start in SMC bypass, then force off by grounding <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL>, then triggering did start the board again but only briefly. Then you can see fans periodically start to spin but stop again and this continues.

You think SMC is shit maybe?

threads.title: 00138 won't turn back on after initial boot
threads.message:
Any history available?

You can try heating PCH area with quality flux; in case of accumulated crap underneath
Reballing SMC can also be done.

Not sure if is related with FDMF6808N chips, but you can try replacing them too.
Use FDMD6708/3030 from reliable source (not China).

threads.title: 00138 won't turn back on after initial boot
threads.message: No history. I tried heating PCH and also replacing SMC and new BIOS but no change. I think I will just replace the board unfortunately.

threads.title: 00138 won't turn back on after initial boot
threads.message:
Did you test removing <TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR>
Also try pressing power button 2-3s.

threads.title: 00138 won't turn back on after initial boot
threads.message: I ended up as last hope, reflowing PCH w/ flux and high temp enough to melt solder and it now is restarting normally.
